name: Corrections Research and Evaluation and Policy Formulation
objective: To conduct, encourage, and coordinate research relating to corrections including the causes, prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of criminal offenders.  To conduct evaluation programs which study the effectiveness of new approaches, techniques, systems, programs, and devices employed to improve the corrections system.
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)
categories: Law, Justice, and Legal Services - Law Enforcement Support

authorizations.text: Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention Act of 1974, as amended; Public Law 93-415, 18 U.S.C. 4351-4353.

pons.pon: Improve or Maintain Quality of Programs
